JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Instructor for the Department of Digitalization
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you want the use your newfound knowledge to help your fellow students? Then join us as an instructor at the Department of Digitalization in the coming Fall 2022

The Department of Digitalization invites applications for a vacant position as an instructor in the following courses for a maximum of three years.

HA(it) courses:
  • Programming and Data Analysis for Business

HA(Digital Mangament) course:
  • Digital Technology and Data-Driven Business

MSc in Information Technology
  • Big Data Management

MSc Data Science:
  • Foundations of Data Science
  • Visual Analytics
  • Business Data Processing and Business Intelligence

Responsibilities

The role of the Instructor is a part-time position, where the instructor will teach & conduct exercises both independently and together with the professor/external lecturer. Teaching duties are of elementary nature to supplement and support learning for students.
Further, the instructor is expected to prepare the exercise sessions, supervise student groups, and other activities that help ensure a good learning environment for the students in the course.

Programming and Data Analysis for Business

The instructor will run exercise sessions and be technical support along with a lecturer. Possibilities for hand-in assessment as well. We work in R and RStudio which you will need experience.

Digital Technology and Data-Driven Business

The instructor will prepare and run exercise sessions and supervise student groups. The exercises include the topics Python, basic statistics, and data analytics and visualization. During the course, the instructors will prepare exercises, supervise student groups during exercises, and give feedback to students on their performance. In addition, instructors should also assist in managing the pre-qualifying exams.

Big Data Management

Two instructors are sought to help prepare and run exercise sessions for the Big Data Management course with Python and Jupyter Notebooks. The content of the sessions is predetermined by the course coordinator, and the main responsibility of the instrcutors will be to review the exercise material ahead of the session and troubleshoot student issues during the session.

To get a sense of the level of the exercise sessions, please refer to the material in “Introduction to machine learning with Python: a guide for data scientists” (Müller & Guido, 2016).

The ideal TA will possess:
  • High proficiency in programming with Python
  • Understanding of basic statistics and machine learning techniques (e.g., classification, clustering, regressions, etc.)
  • Experience implementing machine learning techniques with relevant Python libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, pandas, numpy)
  • Ability to communicate concepts from programming and machine learning to students

Foundations of Data Science, Visual Analytics and Business Data Processing, and Business Intelligence

The instructor will prepare and run exercise sessions and supervise student groups. The exercises include the topics Python, basic statistics, and data analytics and visualization. During the course, the instructors will prepare exercises, supervise student groups during exercises, and give feedback to students on their performance.

Qualifications

The applicant must either hold a Bachelor degree, have passed the first two years of a relevant Bachelor programme or have corresponding qualifications . Emphasis is placed on the applicant’s teaching potential.

Appointment and salary

Appointment and salary is based on the Ministry of Finance agreement regarding student teaching assistents. Salary will only be paid for lessons taught, based on hours reported in LOENUA. At the moment the hourly rate is DKK 229,03 and pension at 1,78 pct..

The recruitment process

Copenhagen Business School invites all qualified candidates to apply for the position.?An appointment committee will review the applications and invite a selection of qualified candidates to an interview.

One of CBS’ strategic goals is the promotion of diversity, which is why every effort has been made to ensure a recruitment process that reduces potential bias.?Applicants are therefore encouraged not to include a photo or unnecessary personal information in their application.

Further information

For further information please contact teaching coordinator Cecilie Ostenfeld, e-mail co.digi@cbs.dk. Information about the department may be found at www.cbs.dk/digi

You can read more about instructor courses on this link.

Application

The application must be sent via the electronic recruitment system, using the link below.

Application must include:
  • Motivated application.
  • Documentation of previous teaching experience.
  • CV.

Applicants will be assessed by a professor employed at Copenhagen Business School.

Details about Copenhagen Business School and the department are available at www.cbs.dk.

Ansøgningsfrist: 16-05-2022

WE TRANSFORM SOCIETY WITH BUSINESS

CBS er et globalt anerkendt business universitet med dybe rødder i den nordiske, socioøkonomiske model. Vi har et bredt fokus på erhvervslivets og samfundets udfordringer i det 21. århundrede. Derfor har vi en samlet portefølje af tværfaglig forskning og uddannelse af høj kvalitet, der har styrket generationer af fagfolk og ledere i den private sektor og andre steder.

Universitetet ligger på Frederiksberg og har ca. 21.000 fuldtids- og deltidsstuderende, 760 fuldtidsansatte videnskabelige medarbejdere, 210 ph.d.-studerende og 680 administrative medarbejdere samt en portefølje af bachelor-, kandidat-, MBA/EMBA-, ph.d.-og efter-/videreuddannelser udbudt på både dansk og engelsk.

Med vores globale profil følger en forpligtelse til at bidrage til udviklingen af transformative kompetencer hos studerende, kandidater og virksomhedsledere gennem vores uddannelsesaktiviteter og muligheder for livslang læring. Komplekse udfordringer kræver en fælles indsats, og derfor fokuserer vores strategi på at styrke nuværende og starte nye partnerskaber med andre videnskaber, erhvervslivet, myndigheder og civilsamfundet.
